subject: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (WHILE ARE YOU DELAYING CONTACTING THE BANK..... BANK CONTACTS DETAILS IS BELOW)
body:
Versions 
 
 
 
 
 
 Federal Ministry of Finance, Headquarters, 
Ahmadu Bello Way, 
Central Business District, 
P.M.Box 41,Garki, 
Abuja, Nigeria 
ATTN; 
Dear Beneficiary. Eliza Dane 
 
 
 
 
I appreciate your receipt of email and the details which was received from you as your next of kin's is okay, your brother John which stand as your next of kin's is okay us, listen and understand that your Funds which value the sum of $6.5 Million USD had been deposited in the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) possession as the only remitting Bank to remit Funds to foreigner in he/her own nominated Bank Account in your country, regarding your email which you stated you are sincerely ready to proceed with the re claiming of this Funds Beneficiary Eliza i will urge and advise you to contact the CBN Governor Office through the Bank details below. 
 
 CBN GOVERNOR EMAIL:cbngovernoroffice01@accountant.com 
CBN GOVERNOR: Mr Olayemi Michael Cardoso 
 
Kindly contact his Office because we have submitted your Funds file to his desk yesterday for him to be aware of you the British citizen who own this Funds which value the sum of $6.5 Million USD is available in claiming his/her Funds. This is the only guarantee Funds which you will be claiming it without any illegal act or activities. Please due forward your direct cell phone number and your DRIVER LICENSE as well please is essenital for the CBN to know you in person before any further procedure on claiming your Funds. Yours Faithfully, 
Nigeria Ministry of Finance Office 
Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun 
Compensation Office 
 
 
 
 
  NIGERIA FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPROVED YOUR FUNDS

subject: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (RE CLAIMING OF YOUR $6.5 MILLION USD FROM THE REMITTING BANK)
body:
Versions 
 
 
 
 
 
 Federal Ministry of Finance, Headquarters, 
Ahmadu Bello Way, 
Central Business District, 
P.M.Box 41,Garki, 
Abuja, Nigeria 
ATTN; 
Dear Beneficiary. Terry 
 
 
 Terry Mr. i am satisfied receiving your receipt of email and with your email i can confirmed dealing with the real foreign beneficiary of the said Funds deposited in an Online Offshore Account of our Central Bank of Nigeria possession as the only Remitting Bank in Nigeria that can remit foreign Funds to the said foreign beneficiary, Mr. Terry as you must known now your Funds value the sum of $6.5 Million USD and the Government of Nigeria has order you as the foreign beneficiary to kindly claim your Funds from the Bank. Your Funds has been with the Central Bank of Nigeria since last September and it unfortunate you didn't contacted us for your Funds re claiming before now but all the same we appreciate receive your response today. 
 Claiming your Funds which value the sum of $6.5 Million USD required all attentions from you, because already there is no limited time to waste in claiming this Funds from the Bank, so therefore i will guide and advise you are to contact the Central Bank of Nigeria Foreign Remittance Office which Mr Folashodun A Shonub head that department, to achieve the process to access your $6.5 Million USD through Online you must contact his Office and comply with all directive for you to easy claim your Funds to your own Bank Account in your country without any delays. I have attached the FUNDS RELEASE ORDER PAYMENT LETTER AND MY DRIVER LICENSE in this email for you to view and be rest assured how guarantee this Funds was approved by the President of Nigeria himself. Yours Faithfully, 
Nigeria Ministry of Finance Office 
Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun 
Compensation Office 
 
 
 
 
  NIGERIA FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPROVED YOUR FUNDS

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (RE CLAIMING OF YOUR $6.5 MILLION USD FROM THE REMITTING BANK)
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your email. It's quite interesting to hear about this fund deposited in an Online Offshore Account of the Central Bank of Nigeria. I must admit, it's not every day that one receives such news.

I'm curious though, how did my name come up as the foreigner to claim these funds? Also, could you please explain more about the process involved in claiming these funds? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Terry

subject: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (TREAT THIS AS URGENCY NOW)
body:
Versions 
 
 
 
 
 
 Federal Ministry of Finance, Headquarters, 
Ahmadu Bello Way, 
Central Business District, 
P.M.Box 41,Garki, 
Abuja, Nigeria 
ATTN; 
Dear Beneficiary. Terry 
 
 
 Your email received, but before i will further release more details about this Funds i will advise you should kindly re confirm your details as the following below to ensure i am satisfy of whom is contacting my Office, so therefore fill back your full details as the following now. 
 
 Full Name: 
 Address: 
 Age: 
 Occupation: 
 Direct Cell Phone Number: 
 Driver License: 
 Next of Kin's: 
 All this is required before any further information from my Office will be coming to you about the Funds availability to you as our foreign beneficiary. Yours Faithfully, 
Nigeria Ministry of Finance Office 
Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun 
Compensation Office 
 
 
 
 
  NIGERIA FEDERAL GOVERNMENT APPROVED YOUR FUNDS

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (TREAT THIS AS URGENCY NOW)
body:
Hello Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your prompt response. I'm quite intrigued by this situation, although I must admit, it's a bit unexpected. Could you please provide more information about these funds? How did they come to be approved in my name? 

I'm also curious about the process involved in transferring these funds. What steps would need to be taken on my end?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Terry

subject: Re: FUNDS RELEASE ORDER FROM PRESIDENCY (WE DEFINITELY NEED TO CONFIRM YOUR DETAILS FIRST BEFORE ANY FURTHER DETAILS ON THIS FUNDS WILL BE COMING FROM US)
body:
Hello Minister Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for your prompt response. I'm really excited to learn more about this opportunity. However, I must apologize as I am not comfortable sharing my personal details over email due to security reasons.

Could you please provide me with more information about these funds? How did the Nigeria Federal Government come to approve these funds for me? Also, could you explain the process of how this works?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Terry
